A tenor violin (or tenor viola) is an instrument with a range between those of the 
cello and the viola. An earlier development of the evolution of the violin family of 
instruments, the instrument is not standard in the modern symphony orchestra. Its 
tuning, typically G2 D3 A3 E4 - an octave below the traditional violin, ... be easily 
heard by the player even when nothing is used over the strings.
